snippet: Jeffrey Katzenberg, DreamWorks Animation’s chief executive, says this is ‘a transitional year’ for the studio.
abstract: DreamWorks Animation reports first-quarter loss of $54.8 million, or 64 cents per share, down from loss of $42.9 million, or 51 cents per share, in year-earlier period; results fall short of analyst expectations; company cites hefty restructuring cost, increased expenses, and other problems as part of what it describes as 'transition year.'
lead_paragraph: Jeffrey Katzenberg, DreamWorks Animation’s chief executive, says this is ‘a transitional year’ for the studio.

headline.main: A Worse-Than-Expected $55 Million First-Quarter Loss for DreamWorks Animation
headline.print_headline: A Worse-Than-Expected $55 Million First-Quarter Loss for DreamWorks Animation
